Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(2) Summary

API management has been changing over the last few years. We're witnessing an proliferation of APIs, both on the provider side where more and more business models have APIs as part of their overall strategy, and on the consumer side where using APIs becomes very much standard practice in software engineering. What does this mean for API management and what are the big trends we can identify in the API management landscape? We'll discuss three important trends: One is the trend towards federated API management where increasingly, multiple technical API management solutions have to be unified into one coherent view of an API landscape. The second is the unbundling of API tooling where we'll see more and more tooling being available which needs to interoperate to allow users to combine them for their specific API management needs. The third one is API governance which increasingly becomes an essential aspect of API strategy, helping an organization to manage and evolve its API landscape in a coherent and scalable way.



Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(3) Getting APIs to Work

A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(6) Securing Public Interfaces

  • API management started from the web's reverse proxy model
  • Resources should be made available while minimizing risks
  • API-specific functions started showing up (e.g., XMLâJSON)


A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(7) Supporting the API Lifecycle



A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(8) API Tooling

  • Going beyond just protecting the operational API
  • The API lifecycle supports the whole API development process
    • Design with support for following guidelines
    • Mocking to quickly allow customers to start developing
    • Documentation to make the API easy to use for everyone
    • Testing to make sure the API works as intended
    • Monitoring to understand use and detect misuse


A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(9) APIs as Business Building Blocks



A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(10) Shifting to a Product Focus

  • Growing API landscapes mean growing complexity
  • Focus on API value over API implementation
  • Decoupling technical management from business value makes sense


A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(11) API Consumption Matters



A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(12) Having APIs isn't Good Enough

  • APIs only provide value when they being consumed
  • API Marketing makes sure to get the most out of API products
  • Increase adoption by decoupling production and marketing


Federated API Management

Federated API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(14) There Cannot Be Only One

  • Growing and evolving API landscapes are the new normal
  • Deciding on the one API style/technology/platform is a losing battle
  • Plan and architect for diversity
  • There is a broad spectrum between The One and Anything Goes


Federated API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(15) Reasons for Federation

  • Organizational units making different purchasing decisions
  • Platforms coming with built-in API management
  • Picking different management solutions for different styles


Federated API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(16) Good Reasons for Federation

(18) API Landscape



The Great Unbundling Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(19) Encapsulation Matters

  • Pick and use tooling that best works for your API management
  • Pick and use tooling that is focused and open
  • Build your platform to be open and extensible

API Governance Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(23) API Guidelines as Shared Practices

  • More API teams mean more ways to solve the same problem
    • Solving API problems is not what teams should focus on
    • Solving API problems in a consistent way helps the API landscape
  • Communications across teams is a challenge
    • Complement channels with documentation of practices


API Governance Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(24) The Anatomy of a Good Guideline

  • Why does the guideline exist?
    • Rationale for creating the guideline
  • What can be done to address the described issue
    • At least one good solution for addressing the issue
  • How to implement the solution
    • At least one way to use the solution in practice
  • Testing that the guideline has been followed
    • Some tests can be automated but many will be by declaration or review


API Governance Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?

(27) Beyond Technology

  • APIs are increasingly becoming business capabilities
  • Plan for your API landscape to become more diverse and more dynamic
  • API management will merge with digital business capability management


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Quo Vadis, API Management?
